required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: The Depth of Endotracheal Tube Insertion
clinical_study.official_title: An Observational Study of The Depth of Endotracheal Tube Insertion
clinical_study.source: The First Affiliated Hospital with Nanjing Medical University

brief_summary.textblock: Virtual experiment : comparing the new method with conventional method of determining the depth of endotracheal intubation.

detailed_description.textblock: Effective airway management is the primary concern of the anesthesiologist. The conventional method of determining the insertion length of the endotracheal tube, 21 cm for women and 23 cm for men, shows a high incidence of endobronchial intubations in the analyzed population.The aim of this study is form a new and safe practice habit by passing the endotracheal tube with the balloon just 2 cm below the vocal cords during intubation.

primary_outcome.measure: the depth of primary insertion of tracheal tube

secondary_outcome.measure: the distance from the corner of mouth to the carina
the distance from the vocal cords to the carina
the distance from the corner of mouth to the vocal cords

study_pop.textblock: adult patients who are scheduled for elective surgery under general anesthesia

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients who are scheduled for elective surgery under general anesthesia
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients with anatomical defects of the face, neck, or upper airway
- Patients at risk for pulmonary aspiration of gastric content

facility.name: The First Affiliated Hospital with Nanjing Medical University

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: The First Affiliated Hospital with Nanjing Medical University
